page.title: 18EDUCATION
page.content: Harlow is divided into neighbourhoods. Each neighbourhood has a Secondary school fed by several Primary schools: Brays Grove,Burnt Mill,Latton Bush, Mark Hall,Passmores,Stewards and St.Marks.Latton Bush is closing down this summer.There are some church controlled schools in Harlow.St.Marks St.Lukes,St.Albans and Holy Cross are all Roman Catholic and St.James and William Martin are Church of England. There are three special schools in Harlow.They are,Commonside, The Mead and Tye Green which is both Primary and Secondary. The Harlow College reopened in 1984 as a combination of the Technical College and the new Tertiary College.
